intro: Randia lecardii, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that resemble starfruits, though they are not related to the common starfruit (Carambola). It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Randia lecardii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
